characters.etymology: Ten (十) + eye (目) looking directly = straight, no deviation
characters.pithy_formula: The eye looks STRAIGHT ahead - I GASP 'JIH?!' at the directness!
characters.story: The eye stares STRAIGHT at me with no deviation. I GASP 'JIH?!' in rising shock - such directness! Ten witnesses confirm: the path is perfectly STRAIGHT.

similar_warning.repulsion: 直 = STRAIGHT line (direction); 真 = TRUE fact (verification)

characters.etymology: Net (罒) + straight (直) = to set up (place something straight in the net)
characters.pithy_formula: I SET UP the trap and COMMAND 'JIH!' - in position!
characters.story: I SET UP the net perfectly straight and COMMAND 'JIH!' with sharp precision. The trap is PLACED - one false step and it springs. Sharp, decisive positioning.

characters.etymology: Eye (目) with hands (八) = tool (implements you see and handle)
characters.pithy_formula: I GRAB the TOOL and COMMAND 'JOO!' - work begins NOW!
characters.story: I GRAB the TOOL with both hands and COMMAND 'JOO!' with sharp authority. Eyes on the work, hands on the implement - the job begins NOW. No hesitation.

characters.etymology: Ten (十) eyes (目) verify = true (multiple witnesses confirm truth)
characters.pithy_formula: Ten eyes see the TRUTH - I SING 'JENNNN!' in pure certainty!
characters.story: Ten eyes witness and confirm - it's TRUE! I SING 'JENNNN!' in a high, sustained note of pure certainty. The truth rings clear, verified by all who see.

similar_warning.repulsion: 真 = TRUE fact (verified by ten eyes); 直 = STRAIGHT path (direction)

characters.etymology: Pictograph of a carpenter's square or work beam = work
characters.pithy_formula: I lift the beam and SING 'GOHHHNG!' - the WORK begins!
characters.story: I lift the heavy work beam overhead, SINGING 'GOHHHNG!' in a sustained note. The WORK begins - my voice holds steady as muscles strain. Pure labor.

characters.etymology: Work (工) + hand = left (the left hand assists in work)
characters.pithy_formula: My LEFT hand drops useless - I GROAN 'Dzwohh...' in frustration.
characters.story: My LEFT hand hangs useless at my side. I GROAN 'Dzwohh...' in low, creaky frustration - the weaker hand, the helper hand, groaning at its lesser role.

similar_warning.repulsion: 左 = LEFT (work hand, lower status); 右 = RIGHT (mouth hand, speaking/eating)

characters.etymology: Mouth (口) + hand = right (the right hand feeds the mouth)
characters.pithy_formula: My RIGHT hand STRIKES and COMMANDS 'YOH!' - dominant force!
characters.story: My RIGHT hand STRIKES with power and COMMANDS 'YOH!' sharply. The dominant hand, the eating hand, the speaking hand - it barks orders while the left obeys.

similar_warning.repulsion: 右 = RIGHT (mouth/eating hand, dominant); 左 = LEFT (work hand, helper)

characters.etymology: Hand (又) + flesh (月) = to possess (hand holding meat = ownership)
characters.moon_flesh_note: 月 here means FLESH (meat held in hand), not moon
characters.pithy_formula: I clutch the meat and GROAN 'Yohh...' - mine, I POSSESS it!
characters.story: I clutch the raw meat in my fist and GROAN 'Yohh...' in low, possessive hunger. MINE. I POSSESS this flesh. The zombie grip tightens - I will not share.

characters.etymology: Shell/money (貝) + possess (有) = bribe (illegal possession of money)
characters.pithy_formula: I SHOVE the BRIBE forward and COMMAND 'HWAY!' - take it!
characters.story: I SHOVE the bag of shells forward and COMMAND 'HWAY!' with sharp corruption. The BRIBE changes hands - money for silence, shells for betrayal. Sharp and dirty.

characters.etymology: Work (工) + shell/money (貝) = tribute (payment for labor/loyalty)
characters.pithy_formula: I present TRIBUTE and COMMAND 'GOHNG!' - the emperor demands!
characters.story: I present the TRIBUTE of shells and labor, COMMANDING 'GOHNG!' with a sharp bow. The emperor demands payment - work turned to money, money turned to power.

characters.etymology: Work (工) + head (頁) = item (things organized by category/nape)
characters.pithy_formula: I check each ITEM and COMMAND 'SHYAHNG!' - count them all!
characters.story: I GRAB each ITEM by the neck and COMMAND 'SHYAHNG!' with sharp inventory. One by one, catalogued and counted - my voice barks the tally into existence.

characters.etymology: Pictograph of a curved blade = knife/sword
characters.pithy_formula: I draw the KNIFE and SING 'DOWWW!' - the blade gleams!
characters.story: I draw the KNIFE from its sheath, SINGING 'DOWWW!' in a sustained high note. The blade gleams in the light - my voice holds steady as steel catches the sun.

similar_warning.repulsion: 刀 = whole KNIFE (no dot); 刃 = sharp EDGE (dot marks the cutting point)

characters.etymology: Knife (刀) + dot (丶) marking the edge = blade (the sharp part)
characters.pithy_formula: The BLADE's edge bites and COMMANDS 'REN!' - sharp and final!
characters.story: The BLADE's edge bites into flesh and COMMANDS 'REN!' with sharp finality. The dot marks where steel meets skin - one decisive cut, one barking command.

similar_warning.repulsion: 刃 = EDGE with dot (marks cutting point); 刀 = whole knife (no dot)

characters.etymology: Seven (七) + knife (刀) = to cut (seven cuts, slicing action)
characters.pithy_formula: I CUT through bone and COMMAND 'CHYEH!' - sliced clean!
characters.story: I CUT through the bone with one stroke, COMMANDING 'CHYEH!' as the blade severs. Clean, decisive - the knife speaks with sharp authority. Sliced in two.

characters.etymology: Knife (刀) + mouth (口) = to summon (call with the authority of a blade)
characters.pithy_formula: I SUMMON the warriors and COMMAND 'JOW!' - come to me NOW!
characters.story: I SUMMON the warriors with a sharp cry, COMMANDING 'JOW!' as my blade points skyward. They come running - the mouth speaks, the knife enforces. Authority absolute.

similar_warning.repulsion: 召 = SUMMON (mouth + knife = call); 昭 adds SUN = EVIDENT (clear as day)

characters.etymology: Sun (日) + summon (召) = evident (clear as the sun, obvious)
characters.pithy_formula: The truth is EVIDENT - I SING 'JOWWW!' as sunlight reveals all!
characters.story: The truth is EVIDENT as sunlight floods the room. I SING 'JOWWW!' in a sustained note - everything clear, nothing hidden. The sun summons truth into the open.

similar_warning.repulsion: 昭 = EVIDENT (sun added = visible); 召 = SUMMON (call without light)

characters.etymology: Shell (貝) + knife (刂) = rule (cut-and-dried law, enforced with penalty)
characters.pithy_formula: The RULE is absolute - I GASP 'DZUH?!' as the knife enforces it!
characters.story: The RULE is carved in stone. I GASP 'DZUH?!' in rising shock as the knife enforces the law - break it and pay with shells, or pay with blood. No mercy.

characters.etymology: Full (畐) + knife (刂) = vice (cut portion of the whole, secondary)
characters.pithy_formula: The VICE-commander steps forward and COMMANDS 'FOO!' - second in power!
characters.story: The VICE-commander steps forward and COMMANDS 'FOO!' with sharp authority. Second to the leader, a cut portion of power - the deputy barks orders in his master's absence.

characters.etymology: Pictograph of a nail = nail (also 4th Heavenly Stem)
characters.pithy_formula: I drive the NAIL in and SING 'DINGGGG!' - struck true!
characters.story: I drive the NAIL into the wood, SINGING 'DINGGGG!' as the hammer strikes. The sustained ring echoes - metal on metal, one perfect note held forever.

similar_warning.repulsion: 丁 = NAIL alone (solid object); 叮 adds MOUTH = STING (piercing sound)

characters.etymology: Mouth (口) + nail (丁) = to sting (piercing sound, sharp sensation)
characters.pithy_formula: The bee STINGS and I SING 'DINGGGG!' - piercing pain rings out!
characters.story: The bee STINGS my arm and I SING 'DINGGGG!' as pain rings through my body. A sustained note of agony - the piercing continues, the sound holds, pure STING.

similar_warning.repulsion: 叮 = STING with mouth (piercing sensation); 丁 = NAIL alone (solid object)

characters.etymology: Mouth (口) approving = can/may (permission granted)
characters.pithy_formula: CAN I? The mouth GROANS 'Kuhhh...' - barely permitted.
characters.story: CAN I do this? The mouth GROANS 'Kuhhh...' in low, reluctant permission. Barely allowed, grudgingly granted - the zombie approval comes slow and creaky.

characters.etymology: Double 可 (can) stacked = older brother (doubly capable, protective)
characters.pithy_formula: OLDER BROTHER arrives and SINGS 'GUHHHH!' - protector is here!
characters.story: My OLDER BROTHER arrives and SINGS 'GUHHHH!' in a sustained note of authority. Doubly capable, doubly protective - his voice holds steady as he shields me.

characters.etymology: Nail/top (丁) + head (頁) = crest (the very top of the head)
characters.pithy_formula: I reach the TOP and GROAN 'Dingggg...' - exhausted at the CREST.
characters.story: I reach the TOP of the mountain and GROAN 'Dingggg...' in low, exhausted triumph. The CREST at last - my zombie moan echoes across the peak. Finally here.

lesson_palace.description: A blacksmith's compound where work is done, hands are skilled, and steel speaks with authority

character_stations.直: Measuring room: straight lines checked by ten eyes
character_stations.置: Trap workshop: nets set up with precision
character_stations.具: Tool wall: implements hang ready for hands
character_stations.真: Verification hall: ten witnesses confirm truth
character_stations.工: Workbench: beams lifted with singing effort
character_stations.左: Left forge: the helper hand works here
character_stations.右: Right forge: the dominant hand commands here
character_stations.有: Treasury: meat clutched in possessive fists
character_stations.貢: Tribute platform: offerings presented to power
character_stations.項: Inventory ledger: items counted by neck
character_stations.刀: Blade rack: knives gleam in rows
character_stations.刃: Sharpening stone: edges honed to points
character_stations.召: Summoning horn: warriors called by blade-point
character_stations.則: Law tablet: rules carved and enforced
character_stations.丁: Nail bin: metal pegs ring when struck
character_stations.哥: Elder's chair: older brother watches over
character_stations.頂: Rooftop peak: the highest point reached
